WorkItem.Description:
In Excel, it is possible to define a named formula, (eg Name="TestFormula", Value = "=1/5", then to reference that by name within a normal cell formula (eg Cell="A1", Formula = "=B2+TestFormula"), which will then allow be calculated as B2+1/5
 
This becomes extremely powerful and flexible when combined with some additional functions supported by named formulae that aren't available for normal cell formulae, for example, the EVALUATE() function.
 
(eg Named formula ="TestFormula2", Value = "=EVALUATE(A1&B1&C1)"
if A1 is a numeric "5", B1 is a string "+" and C1 is a numeric "10"
then creating a formula in cell E1 of "=TestFormula2" will give a calculated value of 15 in cell E1
changing the value of B1 to "/" will give a calculated value of 0.5 in cell E1
etc

Comments.Message:
Technically, named ranges are special cases of such named formulae where the formula happens to be a range. 
Perhaps we can replace the class PHPExcel_NamedRange with some more general class PHPExcel_DefinedName that incorporates both named ranges and named formulae.
